person.persName: Bethel, W. A., Frye, Jesse A., Cushman, Edward E.

div1.p: In the United States Circuit court, for the State of Washington Northern Division
In the matter of the Petition of Jerome C. Corbin for the Writ of Habeas Corpus of Frank E. Corbin a minor

On filing of the return in for court petitioner by H. W. Lueders his attorney states that he denies to contest the return unless the follow ing facts which do not fully appear from the return be admitted

That Frank E. Corbin's father the petitioner herein on December 19, 1903 gave notice to the respondent that Frank E. Corbin was a minor between the age of 18 and 19 years at the time of enlistment and he as the father demanded his release on that ground and also that said minor be allowed no pay

That notwithstanding such notice said military authorities on Jan 5 1904 compeled by duress said minor to accept his first month pay. that on January 11th 1904 he mailed back by express the identical money received to A. S. Rowan commanding Company D- 19 Infantry USA at Vancouver Barracks Vancouver Wash, with a written protest not receiving the same
That the Petition for the Writ of Habeas Corpus was filed Jan 9th 1904- writ served upon respondant Jan 14th 1904

That the General Court Martial was not ordered until Jan 11th 1904- and charges against Frank E. Corbin a minor were not filed until after served of the writ herein on towit Jan 16 1904- and have not yet been served upon said minor

To with Major W. A. Bithel counsel reopened that he admits these facts in open court provided petitioner admits that Frank E Corbin received allowance in the way of clothing at the time of his Enlistment- to which Counsel for petitioner admits taht such clothing were so received by said minor at the time of his enlistment from the U. S. and thereupon petitioner upon the petition return and foregoing facts admitted in open court filed his denounce as following herein
In the United States Circuit Court
District of Washington Northern
Division
In the matter of the Petition of Jerome C Corbin for the Writ of Habeas Corpus for Frank E Corbin a minor

Comes now the petitioner and demurs to the nature of the respondent made and filed herein for the reasonns that the charges for fraudulent enlistment were made and filed against said minor on Jan 16 1904 after the Writ of Habeas Corpus herein had been served upon respondent for the purpose of outstandng this court out of jurisdiction herein
That said return states no facts sufficient to constitute a defense against the petition filed herein
That said return be guaranteed and petition have respondent as prayed for in his petitioner herein
HW Lueders attorney for petitioner
In Re Corbin Habeas Corpus
agreed facts and demurer of petitioner
FILED IN THE U. S. Circuit Courtm DIST. OF WASHINGTON. JAN 18 1904 A. REEVES AYRES, Clerk HM Matthew Deputy
IN THE UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION
In the Matter of Jerome C. Corbin for the Writ of Habeas Corpus of Frank E. Corbin, a minor.
No. 1166 O r d e r .

This matter coming upon the petition, writ and return thereto at this time, and H. W. Lueders Esq., appearing for petitioner, and Jesse A. Frye, United States Attorney, Edward E. Cushman, Assistant United States Attorney, and W. A. Bethel, appearing for respondent, and the Court having heard the matter and being fully advised in the premises, and all things here understood:

Now, therefore, it is hereby ordered that Frank E. Corbin, son of the above named petitioner, be, and hereby is, remanded to the custo- dy of Colonel Joseph F. Huston, 19th Infantry U. S. Army, at vancouver Barracks, State and District of Washington, to await such proceedings as have been instutited by the military authortities of the United States, and to serve such sentence as may be imposed upon him by the military authorities, and after the completion of said hearing and the service of said sentence, if any, he be discharged, to which petitioner excepts and exception allowed.
Done in open Court this 18th day of January, 1904.
C. H. Hanford
Judge.
Due and full service of within acknowledged this day of 189 Attorney for
FORM No. 409 No. 1166
In the Circuit COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON. Northern Division.
THE UNITED STATES vs. In re Jerome C. Corbin
Order
FILED IN THE U. S. Cicruit Court, DIST. OF WASHINGTON. JAN 18 1904 A. REEVES AYRES, CLERK A. N. MOORS Deputy
Jesse A. Frye
UNITED STATES ATTORNEY, SEATTLE, WASHINGTON
CERTIFICATE
United States of America Western District of Washington

I. JAMES C. DRAKE, Clerk of the Circuit Court of the United States, for the Western District of Washington, do hereby certify that the foregoing attached papers constitute the JUDGEMENT ROLL in the following entitled cause, No. 1166 wherein In re: Application Frank E. Corbin Writ of Habeas Corpus Plaintiff and Defendant
In Testimony Whereof, I have hereunto set my hand and affixed the Seal of said Circuit Court, this the 27 day of DEC A. D. 1911
JAMES C. DRAKE, Clerk.
By BO Wright Deputy Clerk.
